definition: to turn one's head/to turn around
to turn/to twist/to wring/to sprain/to swing one's hips
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: They had a meeting, textual twist went.
sentences.chinese: 两人刚一见面，扁鹊扭头就走。

sentences.english: Harry glanced over his shoulder to where the small, maimed creature trembled under the chair.
sentences.chinese: 哈利扭头看了看那边椅子下面发抖的受伤的小生命。

sentences.english: You don't think back over every step you've ever taken, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你是不会每走一步都扭头向后看看的，是吗？

sentences.english: Praying mantids are one of the few insects that can turn their heads.
sentences.chinese: 祈祷螳螂是能扭头的少数昆虫中的一种。

sentences.english: Slowly I turn to face Megatron.
sentences.chinese: 我慢慢地扭头望向威震天。

sentences.english: Ms. Jones turned to glance at me again.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯夫人又扭头瞟了我一眼。

sentences.english: Clare looked round upon her, seated with the others.
sentences.chinese: 克莱尔扭头看去，只见她同其他的女工坐在一起。

sentences.english: I looked away for a second and when I looked back they were gone.
sentences.chinese: 我扭头看了一下，再回过头来，他们已经不见了。

sentences.english: The mare neighed once more, turned and disappeared amongst the trees.
sentences.chinese: 母马又嘶鸣了一声，扭头消失在树林里。

sentences.english: A boxer learns to bob and weave.
sentences.chinese: 拳击手学习急速扭头和闪身。

sentences.english: Ingel passed by the woman turning her head to another side and pretended as if she did not see her.
sentences.chinese: 英格尔假装没有看见她，扭头从她身边走了过去。

sentences.english: Then twist a head to go to and Xie Qiao of the portion talked son to go.
sentences.chinese: 便扭头去和一边的谢桥说话儿去了。

sentences.english: The Sir grieved, twisting the head to want to walk.
sentences.chinese: 先生气坏了，扭头就想走。

sentences.english: My sister turned to me, winking.
I turned around to see the alterations lady.
sentences.chinese: 一扭头，看到那个女裁缝。

sentences.english: She is turning to look at someone, perhaps at Sforza himself.
sentences.chinese: 她扭头向左看着什么，也许是正看着斯福扎吧。

definition: to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to look askance/cross or wall-eyed
to overdo it/to overstep the limit/excessively/above one's head/overhead
to cast a glance
old variant of 瞅[chou3]
(dialect) to look at
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
to stop/to halt/to cease
to pout/to stick out one's lips
stunned/amazed
promptly/at once
to have heard what was said
hastily
